data.title: Wagner in Russia, Poland and The Czech Lands Musical, Literary and Cultural Perspectives by Stephen Muir, Anastasia Belina-Johnson (Eds.), Richard Taruskin (Foreword)
data.meta_description: Wagner in Russia, Poland and the Czech Lands Musical, Literary and Cultural Perspectives by Stephen Muir, Anastasia Belina-Johnson (eds.), Richard Taruskin (foreword) (z-lib.org) - Free ebook download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read book online for free. This document provides information about a book titled "Wagner in Russia, Poland and the Czech Lands: Musical, Literary and Cultural Perspectives". The book contains essays examining Richard Wagner's influence and reception in Russia, Poland, and the Czech Republic (formerly Czechoslovakia) from various musical, literary and cultural perspectives. It is edited by Stephen Muir of the University of Leeds and Anastasia Belina-Johnson of Leeds College of Music and contains contributions from musicologists and scholars exploring topics like Sergey Taneyev's engagement with Wagner's operas, Rimsky-Korsakov's changing views of Wagner, and Wagner's reception in Poland during the communist era. The book is published by Ashgate Publishing.
data.text: Wagner in Russia, Poland and The Czech Lands Musical, Literary and Cultural Perspectives by Stephen Muir, Anastasia Belina-Johnson (Eds.), Richard Taruskin (Foreword)
